required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improving In-hospital Stroke Service Utilisation in China
clinical_study.official_title: Improving In-hospital Stroke Service Utilisation (MISSION) in China: A Cluster Randomised Trial of Interventions to Shorten Door to Needle Times

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
The Central Hospital of Lishui City

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: A cluster randomised controlled trial will be conducted, using hospital as randomisation unit. Hospitals in Zhejiang Province, China, will be randomised into two arms (1:1): an intervention arm and a control arm. Hospitals in the intervention arm will receive a multi-components intervention based on the Behaviour Change Wheel model, whereas hospitals in the control arm will receive no intervention and maintain existing care. The randomisation will be conducted after one-year baseline data collection. The following baseline data will be used for randomisation match: hospital classification, beds in stroke centre, thrombolysis patient number, and percentage of patients receiving thrombolysis within 60 minutes of stroke onset. Hospitals with no stroke centre or with <20 cases received thrombolysis per year will be excluded from the study. The primary outcome will be difference between intervention arm and control arm in the percentage of patients receiving thrombolysis within 60 minutes of stroke onset on the follow-up stage (post-intervention).

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in the percentage of patients who Door-to-Needle Time≤60min
primary_outcome.description: Difference between intervention arm and control arm in the percentage of patients receiving thrombolysis within 60 minutes of stroke onset on the follow-up stage

secondary_outcome.description: The time between hospital arrival and the initiation of IVT
The time between the symptom onset and the initiation of IVT

secondary_outcome.measure: modified Rankin Scale score at discharge
secondary_outcome.description: modified Rankin Scale score at discharge, on which scores range from 0 (no neurologic deficit) to 6 (death)
Intracranial hemorrhage at 24 hours associated with an increase of ≥4 points of NIHSS score from baseline, according to European Cooperative Acute Stroke Study (ECASS) II trial
Score of 0 to 1 on the modified Rankin Scale, on which scores range from 0 (no neurologic deficit) to 6 (death)

arm_group.description: Hospitals in the intervention arm will receive a multi-components intervention based on the Behaviour Change Wheel model
hospitals in the control arm will receive no intervention and maintain existing care

intervention.intervention_name: Behaviour Change Wheel model guided intervention
intervention.description: Interventions are developed on a psychological model, the Behaviour Change Wheel (BCW) .The fundamental of BCW consists of three essential elements: capability, motivation, and opportunity. Improving individual's capability, providing motivation, and increasing opportunities are goals of behaviour change intervention. To achieve the goals, 9 intervention components have been proposed in the BCW framework, and 6 components will be used in current study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- AIS patients receiving IVT within 4.5 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are not willing to attend this trial

facility.name: The second affiliated hospital of Zhejiang University
